name: PostPaymentInstrument
description:
Create a payment instrument.
If such payment card or bank account payment instrument already exists then updates it instead.

Organization-Id.description: Organization identifier in scope of which need to perform request (if not specified, the default organization will be used).

ResourceCustomFields.description: Custom Fields list as a map `{"custom field name": "custom field value", ...}`. The format must follow the saved format (see Custom Fields section for the formats).

ResourceId.description: The resource ID. Defaults to UUID v4.

country.description: The contact country ISO Alpha-2 code.

hash.description: A hash that can be used to compare multiple contacts for identical attribute values.

RiskMetadata.description: Risk metadata used for 3DS and risk scoring.

country.description: Country ISO Alpha-2 code for specified ipAddress.

deviceVelocity.description: Number of transactions for this device (based on fingerprint) in the last 24 hours.

distance.description: Distance between IP Address and Billing Address geolocation (kilometers).

hasMismatchedBankCountry.description: True if the bank country and geo-IP address are not the same.

hasMismatchedBillingAddressCountry.description: True if the billing address country and geo-IP address are not the same.

hasMismatchedHolderName.description: True if the customer's name from billing address and from customer's primary address are not the same.

hasMismatchedTimeZone.description: True if the browser time zone and IP address associated time zone are not the same.

isHosting.description: True if customer's ip address is related to hosting.

isProxy.description: True if customer's ip address is related to proxy.

isTor.description: True if customer's ip address is related to TOR.

isVpn.description: True if customer's ip address is related to VPN.

isp.description: Internet Service Provider name, if available.

paymentInstrumentVelocity.description: Number of transactions for this payment instrument (based on fingerprint) in the last 24 hours.

score.description: Risk score computed per all the factors.

RiskMetadata.title: Risk metadata

BrowserData.description: Browser data used for 3DS and risk scoring.

colorDepth.description: The browser's color depth in bits per pixel obtained using the `screen.colorDepth` property.

isJavaEnabled.description: Whether Java is enabled in a browser or not. Value is returned from the `navigator.javaEnabled` property.

language.description: The browser's language settings returned from the `navigator.language` property.

screenHeight.description: The browser's screen height returned from the `screen.height` property.

screenWidth.description: The browser's screen width returned from the `screen.width` property.

timeZoneOffset.description:
The browser's time zone offset in minutes from UTC.
A positive offset indicates the local time is behind UTC, and negative is ahead.
Can find it with `(new Date()).getTimezoneOffset()` property.

BrowserData.title: Browser data

accountNumberType.description:
Bank's Account Number type. A valid value is basic bank account number (BBAN) or international bank account number (IBAN).
This is the object for the BBAN.

accountNumber.description: Bank's account number. Detailed information about all ISO 13616-compliant national IBAN formats is available in the [SWIFT IBAN Registry](https://www.swift.com/standards/data-standards/iban).

accountNumberType.description:
Bank's Account Number type. A valid value is basic bank account number (BBAN) or international bank account number (IBAN).
This is the object for the IBAN.

_embedded.description: Any embedded objects available that are requested by the `expand` querystring parameter.

ServerTimestamp.description: Read-only timestamp, automatically assigned on back-end.

_embedded.description: Any embedded objects available that are requested by the `expand` querystring parameter.

acquirerName.description: Acquirer name, available only when transaction use gateway, else null.

bumpOffer.description: Bump offer information. Null if hasBumpOffer is false.

language.description: The language of the bump offer that was displayed to user (useful for finding any translation problems).

selectedOffer.description: Offer selected by a customer. Null if bump offer outcome is not `selected`.

version.description: The name of the version that was picked (useful for measuring split tests).

dcc.description: Dynamic Currency Conversion detailed information. Null if hasDcc is false.

base.description: Initial amount and currency to convert from.

quote.description: Suggested amount and currency to convert to.

usdMarkup.description: The amount of markup translated to USD.

discrepancyTime.description: The time of the most recent discrepancy on the transaction.

disputeTime.description: Time the dispute was created, else null.

originalCode.description: The raw, unmapped gateway's response code.

originalMessage.description: The raw, unmapped gateway's response message.

hadDiscrepancy.description: True if the transaction has been updated due to a discrepancy with its. source of truth.

hasBumpOffer.description: True if transaction has a Bump offer.

hasDcc.description: True if transaction has Dynamic Currency Conversion applied.

isMerchantInitiated.description: True if the transaction was initiated by the merchant.

isProcessedOutside.description: True if the transaction was processed outside of Rebilly.

isReconciled.description: True if the transaction has been verified with gateway batch data.

orderId.description: The transaction's order ID.  This ID must be unique within a 24 hour period. This field was renamed to the `requestId`.

reportAmount.description: Transaction amount converted to organization selected report currency.

revision.description:
The number of times the transaction data has been modified.
The revision is useful when analyzing webhook data to determine if the change takes precedence over the current representation.

scheduledTime.description: The time the transaction is scheduled for collection.

settlementTime.description: The time that the transaction was settled by the banking instuition.

velocity.description: The number of transactions by the same customer in the past 24 hours.

billingDescriptor.description:
The billing descriptor that appears on the periodic billing statement. Commonly
12 or fewer characters for a credit card statement.

gatewayName.description: Payment Gateway name, available only after the gateway is selected for the transaction.

hasAmountAdjustment.description: True if transaction has amount adjustment.

invoiceIds.description: The invoice IDs related to transaction.

isRetry.description: True if this transaction is retry.

planIds.description: The plan IDs related to transaction's order(s).

purchaseAmount.description: The amount actually purchased which may have differed from the originally requested amount in case of an adjustment.

redirectUrl.description: The URL to redirect the end-user when an offsite transaction is completed. Defaults to the website's configured URL.

requestAmount.description: The amount in the payment request. If adjusted, the purchase amount and billing amount may vary from it.

requestId.description: The transaction's request ID.  This ID must be unique within a 24 hour period. Use this field to prevent duplicated transactions.

retryNumber.description: The position in the sequence of retries.

subscriptionIds.description: The orders IDs related to transaction's invoice(s).

enrolled.description: Is the cardholder enrolled in 3D Secure.

isDowngraded.description: If 3D Secure 2 was attempted but downgraded to 3D Secure 1.

acceptedCurrencies.description: Accepted currencies (array of the currency three letter codes).

additionalFilters.description:
The additional filters are used to determine whether the gateway account can be selected for the transaction to be processed.
For example, the filter may put a maximum amount value. If the transaction is above that amount, this gateway account wouldn't be used.
This follows our standard filter format.

approvalWindowTtl.description: The time window (in seconds) allotted for approving an offsite transaction before it is automatically `abandoned`.

cityField.description: The gateway account's city field (also known as line 2 descriptor).

dccForceCurrency.description:
Force dynamic currency conversion to the specified currency on each sale.
Leave it empty to disable force DCC.

dccMarkup.description: Dynamic currency conversion markup in basis points.

dynamicDescriptor.description: True, if Gateway Account allows dynamic descriptor.

excludedDccQuoteCurrencies.description: Excluded Dynamic Currency Conversion Quote Currencies.

isDown.description: True if gateway is currently in downtime period.

merchantCategoryCode.description: The gateway account's merchant category code.

reconciliationWindowEnabled.description: If a transaction is not reconciled within the `reconciliationWindowTtl` time, then the transaction is marked as `abandoned`.

reconciliationWindowTtl.description: The time window (in seconds) allotted for a reconciliation to occur. If it is not reconciled in that time, then the transaction is marked as `abandoned`.

sticky.description: Customer's payment instrument will "stick" to the gateway account for future transactions when enabled.

timeout.description: Gateway Account request timeout in seconds.

DigitalWallets.description: Configure which digital wallets are enabled.

applePay.description: The Apple Pay digital wallet configuration. Skip if not using Apple Pay.

isEnabled.description: Set true if Apple Pay is enabled.

googlePay.description: The Google Pay‚Ñ¢ digital wallet configuration. Skip if not using Google Pay‚Ñ¢.

isEnabled.description: Set true if Google Pay is enabled.

merchantName.description: The merchant name in Google Pay. Leave blank if using FramePay.

merchantOrigin.description: The merchant origin in Google Pay. The fully qualified domain name. Leave blank if using FramePay.

DigitalWallets.title: Digital Wallets

_embedded.description: Any embedded objects available that are requested by the `expand` querystring parameter.

invoiceCount.description: An auto-incrementing number based on the sequence of invoices. If set to 0, then this record is a Lead, otherwise is a Customer.

lastPaymentTime.description: The most recent time of an approved payment for the customer.

paymentCount.description: The number of approved payments for the customer.

paymentToken.description:
A write-only payment token; if supplied, it will be converted into a
payment instrument and be set as the `defaultPaymentInstrument`. The
value of this property will override the `defaultPaymentInstrument`
in the case that both are supplied. The token may only be used once
before it is expired.

revision.description:
The number of times the customer data has been modified.
The revision is useful when analyzing webhook data to determine if the change takes precedence over the current representation.

clickId.description: Lead source click id (may come from an ad server).

salesAgent.description: Lead source sales agent (eg James Bond).

subAffiliate.description: Lead source sub-affiliate also called a sub-id or click id in some circles (eg 123456).

amount.description: Average approved payment amount in Merchant's reporting currency.

amountUsd.description: Average approved payment amount in USD.

method.description:
The payment method supported vault.
See [Payment Instruments API](https://api-reference.rebilly.com/tag/Payment-Instruments).

amount.description: Revenue amount in Merchant's reporting currency.

name.description: The tag is unique name, which is case-insensitive.

_embedded.description: Any embedded objects available that are requested by the `expand` querystring parameter.

expirationReminderNumber.description: Number of expiration reminder events triggered.

expirationReminderTime.description: Time expiration reminder event will be triggered.

stickyGatewayAccountId.description: Default gateway account ID used for transactions.

bin.description: The card's bin (the PAN's first 6 digits).

fingerprint.description: A unique value to identify the payment instrument regardless of variable values. It contains alphanumeric values.

status.description:
Payment instrument status. When an instrument is `active` it means it has been used at least once for an approved transaction.
To remove an instrument from being in use, set it as `deactivated` (see the deactivation endpoint).

_embedded.description: Any embedded objects available that are requested by the `expand` querystring parameter.

accountNumberType.description: Bank's account number type. A valid value is basic bank account number (BBAN) or international bank account number (IBAN).

fingerprint.description: A unique value to identify the bank account. It contains alphanumeric values.

last4.description: The last 4 digits of the bank account.

_embedded.description: Any embedded objects available that are requested by the `expand` querystring parameter.

dueReminderNumber.description: Number of past due reminder events triggered.

dueReminderTime.description: Time past due reminder event will be triggered.

afterAttemptPolicies.description: The policy on the attempt finishes.

afterRetryEndPolicies.description: The policy on the retry ends.

revision.description:
The number of times the invoice data has been modified.
The revision is useful when analyzing webhook data to determine if the change takes precedence over the current representation.

collectionPeriod.description: Collection period - difference between paidTime and issuedTime in days.

delinquentCollectionPeriod.description: Delinquent collection period - difference between paidTime and dueTime in days.

invoiceNumber.description: An auto-incrementing number based on the sequence of invoices for any particular customer.

notes.description: Notes for the customer which will be displayed on the invoice.

paymentFormUrl.description:
URL where the customer can be redirected to pay for the invoice
with one of the methods which are available for this customer.
It's an alternative to creating a new transaction with empty `methods`.

poNumber.description: Purchase order number which will be displayed on the invoice.

subscriptionId.description: The related order's ID if available, otherwise null.

amount.description: Total amount that was discounted by this Coupon.

_embedded.description: Any embedded objects available that are requested by the `expand` querystring parameter.

periodNumber.description: Invoice item subscription order period number.

taxCategoryId.description: The product's tax category identifier string.

CommonProduct.description:
Products include digital goods, services, and physical goods.
Products appear on invoice line items. If you set a tax category identifier,
taxes will be calculated upon invoice generation. If it is shippable,
shipping will be calculated upon invoice generation. Pricing and
variations are set within Plans.

options.description:
The product options such as color, size, etc. The product options definition does
not include option values. Those are defined within the plans.

requiresShipping.description: If the product requires shipping, shipping calculations will be applied.

unitLabel.description: The unit label, such as per `seat` or per `unit`.

invoiceTimeShift.description: You can shift issue time and due time of invoices for this plan.

isTrialOnly.description: Whether a plan has a trial without recurring instructions.

name.description: The plan name, displayed on invoices and receipts.

productOptions.description: Name-value pairs to specify the product options.

limit.description:
The number of invoices this subscription order will generate
(if 1, it will not generate any beyond the initial order creation).
For example, set this property to `12`, when the `periodUnit` is month and the
`periodDuration` is 1, for a 1 year contract billed monthly.

recurringInterval.description: The service interval. For a one-time item, use `null`.

revision.description:
Increments when the plan is modified. 
Compare to materialized subscription items revision.

setup.description: The setup. Set `null` if no setup.

price.description: The price of a setup - 0 is a valid value (for free).

trial.description: The trial. Set `null` if no trial.

price.description: The price of the trial. For a free trial, use `0`.

formula.description:
The price formula determines what algorithm is used to calculate the invoice price based on a few factors,
- the quantity in the order (which may be variable if usage pricing, otherwise determined when creating the order)
- the price brackets data

To determine which formula is correct, please see the price formula documentation.

PlanBillingTiming.description:
The billing timing in relation to the service period.
For `prepaid` plans the customer pays when the service period starts,
whereas, for `postpaid` plans, the customer pays when the service period ends.

InvoiceTimeShift.description:
The invoice time shift in conjunction with `billingTiming` allows to setup different billing use cases such as:
- Bill immediately when the service period _starts_
- Bill immediately after the service period _ends_
- Bill _interval of time_ before the service period _starts_
- Bill _interval of time_ after the service period _starts_
- Bill _interval of time_ before the service period _ends_
- Bill _interval of time_ after the service period _ends_
It allows to control the billing time.

DueTimeShiftInstruction.description:
The calculation instruction of due time.
This is used in conjunction with the **billing anchor** to calculate due time of invoice.
The chronology of due time shift is always **after**.

IssueTimeShiftInstruction.description:
The calculation instruction of billing time.
This is used in conjunction with the **service period anchor** to calculate the time the invoice is issued.

chronology.description: The chronology of the billing time relatively to the service period start.

amount.description: A sum of all invoice taxes.

country.description: The organization country ISO Alpha-2 code.

invoiceTimeZone.description: Invoice will use this time zone to display time otherwise UTC will be used. Example "America/New_York".

isPrimary.description: True, if Organization is primary (available to set as true only, other organizations will become as isPrimary=false).

taxDescriptor.description: The organization's tax label. This will be displayed on the invoice.

integrationType.description: What kind of integration organization looks for.

monthlyTransactions.description: The amount of monthly processed transaction.

products.description: The list of products organization is interested in.

InvoiceRetryScheduleInstruction.description: The calculation instruction of scheduled time.

PurchaseBumpSplitVersionName.description: The name of bump offer version, useful to make split tests.

TransactionNotificationUrl.description:
The URL where a server-to-server POST notification will be sent.  It  will be sent when the
transaction's result is finalized after a timeout or an offsite interaction. Do not trust the
notification; follow with a GET request to confirm the result of the transaction. Please
respond with a 2xx HTTP status code, or we will reattempt the request again.
The 2 placeholders are available to use in this URI: `{id}` and `{result}`.

afterAttemptPolicy.description: The policy on the attempt finishes.

afterRetryEndPolicy.description: The policy on the retry ends.

CommonScheduleInstruction.description: The calculation instruction of scheduled time.

$ul: **type**: A URI reference [[RFC3986](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986)] that identifies the problem type. It should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type. When this member is not present, its value is assumed to be "about:blank".
**title**: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.
**detail**: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

**type**: A URI reference [[RFC3986](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986)] that identifies the problem type. It should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type. When this member is not present, its value is assumed to be "about:blank".
**title**: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.
**detail**: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

**type**: A URI reference [[RFC3986](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986)] that identifies the problem type. It should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type. When this member is not present, its value is assumed to be "about:blank".
**title**: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.
**detail**: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.
